intro: Urostigma trichocarpum, commonly known as the hairy fruit bladder, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, including Kenya and Tanzania, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and distinctive, bladder-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in rocky or disturbed soils, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
